error.signature: Fatal error: Uncaught Error: Class 'App\Service\MyService' not found in /var/www/app/src/Controller/MainController.php:15

verdict.summary: Class not found errors during autoloading typically occur when the PSR-4 namespace does not match the directory structure, the composer autoload map is stale, or the class file has a typo in its namespace declaration.

dead_ends.action: Manually requiring class files with require_once throughout the codebase
dead_ends.why_fails: Bypasses the autoloader entirely, creating a fragile dependency chain that breaks when files move. This does not scale and defeats the purpose of PSR-4 autoloading.

dead_ends.action: Changing directory structure without updating composer.json autoload section
dead_ends.why_fails: The autoloader map is generated from composer.json. Moving files without updating the PSR-4 mapping causes further class not found errors.

workarounds.action: Run composer dump-autoload to regenerate the autoload map
workarounds.how: Execute 'composer dump-autoload' (or 'composer dump-autoload -o' for optimized classmap). This rebuilds vendor/autoload.php and the classmap files based on the current composer.json autoload configuration.

workarounds.action: Verify the namespace declaration matches the PSR-4 directory structure
workarounds.how: Check that the class file's namespace matches the path relative to the autoload root defined in composer.json. For example, if autoload is 'App\' => 'src/', then src/Service/MyService.php must declare 'namespace App\Service;'.

leads_to.condition: when custom autoloader is registered but conflicts with Composer's autoloader

preceded_by.condition: when composer install was not run after adding new dependencies

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Class not found from autoloading is about PSR-4 mapping issues, while general class not found can also be about missing extensions or interfaces
